item.title: Path of Exile 2 Hacker Compromised 66 Player Accounts
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/path-of-exile-2-hacker-compromises-66-player-accounts/

Path of Exile 2’s lead developers have revealed that a hacker was able to compromise 66 player accounts recently. 

As spotted by 404Media, Path of Exile 2’s lead developers, Jonathan and Mark, recently appeared on a podcast with Ghazzy TV and Darth Microtransaction. During this interview, the duo was asked whether there had been a data breach at the studio. Mark responded that there had been a situation where a Steam account got hacked, which gave the hacker access to an admin account on Path of Exile 2’s website. 

The developers revealed that they are now aware of how the hacker took over the admin account, but they do not understand the “full scope” of what occurred then. Mark explained that one of their admin accounts was linked to a Steam account, and the user of this account wasn’t aware of that. The Path of Exile 2 hacker compromised this account through Steam support, and as the user was not using the account, the malicious activity wasn’t noticed. 

Another reason the Path of Exile 2 hacker went unnoticed was a bug in the system. Mark elaborated that whenever an admin account makes changes, the events are logged into an audit log, which can be checked later. However, due to a bug in the system, the password changes were not recorded as events but as notes instead. The hacker was able to delete these notes, which is why the team at GGG could not tell what was wrong when they looked through the accounts. 

Mark confirmed that 66 notes were deleted, which means that the Path of Exile 2 hacker was able to compromise 66 accounts. However, their log history only extends for 30 days, and the hack began 5 days before that, so the full extent is unknown. 

Mark stated they would release a report with all the information they could gather in a day or two. They feared GGG’s data would be breached, and the hacker might gain access to the servers, but that wasn’t the case. The development team also added a bunch of more “security stuff,” which Mark admits should have already been in place. 

Mark also confirmed that the moment the team realised what was going on, they immediately reset the passwords for all admin accounts and deleted all sessions to ensure their safety. Since then, the Path of Exile 2 hacker has not compromised any other accounts.

item.title: When is the Next Steam Sale? Steam Sale Dates, Next Fest, and More!
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/next-steam-sale-steam-sale-dates/

Seriously, who among us doesn’t enjoy a game sale? We can spend too much money, ignore the pleas of our significant others to stop emptying the bank account, and never touch those new games as they wind up in the neverending backlog! It’s a treat! But honestly, the next Steam sale is right around the corner, and it promises to be a good one. If you’re looking to spend a few bucks on quality titles, Valve’s storefront is the place to be in 2025!

Upcoming Steam Sales in 2025

2025 appears to be a rather significant year for Steam sales. Throughout the first half of the year, we have numerous festivals highlighting often overlooked genres, like the colony sim, idler, and visual novel fests. However, there are also the usual major sales, like Steam Next Fest, Spring Sale, and Summer Sale.

  • Real-Time Strategy Fest
    • January 20 – 27
  • Idler Fest
    • February 3 – 10
  • Couch Co-op Fest
    • February 10 – 17
  • Steam Next Fest: February 2025
    • February 24 – March 3
  • Visual Novel Fest
    • March 3 – 10
  • Steam Spring Sale 2025
    • March 13 – 20
  • City Builder & Colony Sim Fest
    • March 24 – 31
  • Sokoban Fest
    • April 21 – 28
  • Wargames Fest
    • April 28 – May 5
  • Creature Collector Fest
    • May 12 – 19
  • Zombies vs. Vampires Fest
    • May 26 – June 2
  • Steam Next Fest: June 2025
    • June 9 – 16
  • Fishing Fest
    • June 16 – 23
  • Steam Summer Sale 2025
    • June 26 – July 10

Games We Recommend You Buy On Sale

You can never have too many video games. By now, you likely have a huge backlog to work through, but if you can score any of the following on a deep discount, we highly recommend you jump at the opportunity!

  • Stardew Valley
  • Balatro
  • Cyberpunk 2077
  • Helldivers 2
  • Baldur’s Gate 3
  • Elden Ring
  • Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
  • Phasmophobia
  • Dead by Daylight
  • Palworld

What do you intend to pick up on the next Steam Sale? Let us know in the comments below, or visit the Insider Gaming community forum to start a discussion!

The wide array of sales throughout the year isn’t the only thing booming! Valve now offers SteamOS for third-party devices, significantly boosting the handheld scene!

item.title: Xbox To Get A New Game From “Legendary” Japanese Franchise
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-to-get-a-new-game-from-legendary-japanese-franchise/

Xbox is set to get a new game from a “legendary Japanese IP” in 2025. According to a new report from Jez Corden of Windows Central, the mystery game during Xbox’s upcoming Developer Direct will be from a classic Japanese franchise.

Corden didn’t spoil anything regarding what the game may be, but did say it has “decades of history”.

“[Our] sources indicate that it is a new entry in a legendary Japanese IP which has decades of history, and should make a lot of fans happy,” he said.

He continued: “Indeed, Microsoft has won some strong support from the region lately from studios like Square Enix for Final Fantasy, HoYoverse for Genshin Impact, and Sega/ATLUS for Persona, and we suspect this new game will help further that trend.”

Aside from the unknown Japanese title, the Xbox Developer Direct on January 23 will feature looks at games like South of Midnight, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, and DOOM: The Dark Ages.

“Presented by the game creators themselves, Developer_Direct offers an in-depth look at upcoming titles, how they’re being created, and who’s creating them,” Xbox says.

In addition to the four games expected to be shown during the event, Xbox is gearing up for a strong 2025. The company also has Avowed scheduled to release in February as well as the reboot of Fable expected to launch sometime this year.

item.title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Coming to Game Pass? (Answered)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-kingdom-come-deliverance-2-coming-game-pass/

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is one of 2025’s most anticipated games. It’s a direct continuation of the 2018 title that introduced Warhorse Studios’ open-world RPG universe to the wider gaming community. Like many games these days, many players are asking one question about this impending release: ‘Is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 coming to Game Pass?’

Let’s dive into that topic and find out if this game will be released on Xbox or PC Game Pass – or both.

Will Kingdom Come Be On Game Pass?

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will not be on Game Pass at launch, but it could be added to the service further down the line. In 2019, the first Kingdom Come title was added to Game Pass – but it has since been removed.

Those seeking to enjoy Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 on Xbox and PC will need to do so after paying full price for the game.

When Kingdom Come Deliverance was added to Game Pass all those years ago, it was still a relatively unknown, assuming title – little more than an indie release at that point. This time around, Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is a highly anticipated, epic title backed by a big publisher and years of development.

Is Kingdom Come Being Added to PS Plus?

There’s no indication that Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will be added to PS Plus – it’s the same situation as the Game Pass question.

Towards the end of 2022, Kingdom Come Deliverance appeared on PS Plus. It was removed a few months later at the start of 2023, just a short while before the follow-up title was announced.

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will be released on February 4, 2025. Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum if you intend to buy the game when it’s out.
